column2: AK DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column8: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 2. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column6: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column8: wait until the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 3. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
4. When driving on a multi-lane highway, you should __________ if you are driving slower than the traffic around you.
5. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column6: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column8: look both ways and be ready to stop.

column2: 6. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column6: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column8: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.

column2: 7. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column6: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column8: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column10: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.

column2: 8. Emergency vehicles:
column6: may use a loudspeaker to give instructions.
column8: have the right-of-way when using siren and red/blue lights.

column2: 9. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column6: move to another lane if possible.
column10: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.

column2: 10. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: look toward the right side of the road.
column6: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.
column8: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.
column10: look toward the left side of the road.

column2: 11. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
12. What does this sign indicate?
13. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 14. Warning signs are normally:
15. Regulatory signs are:
16. Before entering a traffic circle, drivers must slow down and yield to ___________ in the traffic circle.
17. This road sign means:
18. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: having them checked by a mechanic.
column8: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.

column2: 19. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.
column8: look for a detour or another route.
column10: remove the sign and move forward.
